column4: can someone tell me what is IRQ and OS and what does it do pls
or.. not a physical item.. but a term
IRQ is easiest explained by wikipedia.. it's a general computer hardware item...

hmm.. I just read that article.. and it's very dry and technical.. basically it's a way for the cpu to be alerted when something wants attention.. so instead of the cpu asking the cd-rom, "are you done yet?" "are you done yet?"  and so on.. the cd-rom tells the cpu when it's done
ahh.. fan.. sorry.. for a shorter while I would guess.. depends on a lot of other stuff.. cooling in the case and so on
yes.. with a powerful enough computer that should be possible.. I'm not sure about how I would do it though..
I don't think you can, not with the normal filesystem at least..
I'm not entirely sure though.. there might be something clever out there
you could encrypt it, change the permissions so noone but you can read the contents and so on
possible, yes... easy to do and keep working through updates and so on, no
administrative password? you mean your user password? (ie the one you log in with?)
when do you use this password?
that is the same password you use when you log in
when you click on "Synaptic Package Manager" in System, Administration ?
